What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Phoenix abscess

You are a patient: You are 45 AND your biological gender is male.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Severe, persistent pain in the lower right molar area
- Tenderness and swelling around the affected tooth
- Increased mobility of the tooth
- Exacerbated pain when biting or applying pressure
- Loss of dental vitality in that tooth
These symptoms came into fruition gradually over the past two weeks, starting with mild discomfort that worsened after a recent root canal treatment. The pain has become intense and persistent, sometimes waking me up at night. I notice that the tooth feels loose and there's some swelling and tenderness when I press on it. I also realize that the tooth no longer responds to cold or heat, indicating it may have lost its vitality.
